humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The largest tumor in the left breast is 3.2 cm in greatest dimension, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive lobular carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for staging breast cancer is based on the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the left breast shows an invasive lobular carcinoma with the largest tumor measuring 3.2 cm in greatest dimension in the upper outer quadrant, and additional foci in the retroareolar area and lower outer quadrant up to 1.1 cm in greatest dimension. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
